title: test_gitrepo.test_protocols('https',) failing intermittently
body:
In gh-5204, @adswa reported that `datalad.support.tests.test_gitrepo.test_protocols('https',)` failed.  Looking through recent builds, I spotted it in another one.

```
======================================================================
ERROR: datalad.support.tests.test_gitrepo.test_protocols('https',)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 198, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 177, in _wrap_skip_if_no_network
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 750, in _wrap_with_tempfile
    return t(*(arg + (filename,)), **kw)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/support/tests/test_gitrepo.py", line 1580, in _test_protocols
    GitRepo.clone('%s://github.com/datalad-tester/testtt' % proto, destdir)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/support/gitrepo.py", line 1108, in clone
    protocol=GitProgress,
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/cmd.py", line 509, in run
    **results,
datalad.support.exceptions.CommandError: CommandError: 'git clone --progress https://github.com/datalad-tester/testtt /tmp/datalad_temp__test_protocolspk4hbb4q' failed with exitcode 128 [err: 'Cloning into '/tmp/datalad_temp__test_protocolspk4hbb4q'...
error: RPC failed; curl 18 transfer closed with outstanding read data remaining
fatal: expected flush after ref listing']

```

https://travis-ci.com/github/datalad/datalad/jobs/454195238
https://travis-ci.com/github/datalad/datalad/jobs/454430836
